info.title: TD/OMS - Solution API
info.description:
The TD/OMS Solution API allows you to interact with objects. You can Connect, Change or Disconnect an object. Also other actions like Lock, Unlock and Move are availabe.

You can also perform operation on multiple solutions under a single request.

port.description: The port to which the server is listening

/change.description: Solution attributes can be Changed with this path

changeSolutiopn.summary: How to specify the change solutuion request input parameters value.

/connect.description: Objecto can be added to a fix with this path

messages.messageText: Solution .classpath... type *STMF already connected to fix XT0589. &N Cause . . . . . :   You requested the connection of IFS-object .classpath... type *STMF in directory  to fix XT0497 in application XMP. The object itself or one of its details serves however already as main object in fix XT0589. You cannot connect the same object to several fixes without using the override code. &N Recovery  . . . :   Use the override code and connect the object again or refer to fix XT0589.

status.description: The return status which will inform us about how the API ended.

applicationCode.description: Specify the application code of the task to which the object must be connected.

fixNumber.description: Specify the task to which the object must be connected.

objectCode.description:
Specify the object which must be connected to the task.

 *IFSOBJ                                                                 
     Use this value if you want to specify an object from the integrated 
     file system (IFS) instead of the normal OS/400 library structure.   
                                                                         
 character-value                                                         
     Specify the object code of the object.

objectType.description: Specify the type of the object which must be connected to the task.

memberCode.description:
When connecting a message or a source member the name of this detail must also be specified. The possible values are:                    

 *NONE                                                
     No detail is involved.                           
                                                      
 detail-code                                          
     Specify the name of the message or source member.

sourceProcessing.description:
Indicate if the source also has to be transferred through the maintenance cycle. The possible values are:           

*SAME                                                    
    The source processing does not change. If the object is connected to the fix the source processing will become *YES if the object has a related source (found or not found) and *NONE if the object does not have a source (like a data area). Future solution types may cause the source processing to depend on it. 

*YES                                                                    
    If the object is transferred through the maintenance cycle, so will the related source.                                                 

*NO
    The object is related to a source, but the source is not transferred through the maintenance cycle.                                      
                                                                        
*NONE                                                                   
    The object is not related to a source.

overrideCode.description:
If an object is transferred through the maintenance cycle, it is possible that it is overtaking a copy of itself which is connected to another fix. In this case the solutions merge into one but stay connected to two or more
different fixes. This is called solution merging.         
                                                          
When a merged solution is transferred all other fixes will follow. This is easy to understand if you see that it is actually the same object which is transferred. The possible values are:                                      

*SAME                                                    
    Indicates that the override code does not change. If an object is first connected to a fix the solution is not a merged object, not even when it is already connected to another fix. In this case an error is reported to the calling program stating that the object is already connected to another fix.          

*MERGED                                                
    If the object you are about to connect is already connected to another fix, this value will cause it to be connected as a merged object.         

*LEAD (DEPRECATED)                                                  
    This value is retained for backwards compatibility. Please see  *MERGED.                                                        
                                                                    
*FOLLOW (DEPRECATED)                                                
    This value is retained for backwards compatibility. Please see  *MERGED.

solutionType.description:
The solution type indicates what actions are planned on the connected object. The possible values are:         

*SAME                                                      
    Indicates that the solution type does not change. This value defaults to *CHANGE when an object is first connected connected to a fix.                          

*CHANGE                                                 
    Use this value to indicate an object on which maintenance is to be performed. The connected source is also transferred through the maintenance cycle and normal version numbering is executed on the object.   

*COMPILE                                                   
    Use this value to indicate an object on which no maintenance is to be performed. This solution type can be used when only a recompile of the object is required.                                              

*TERMINATE                                                
    Use this solution type to indicate an object which has reached the end of its life. If this solution is transferred through the maintenance cycle and it finds one or more copies of itself then these copies are deleted. The last step is the deletion of the object in the production environment.

routeCode.description:
Specify the route in which this solution resides. The route code only needs to be specified if you are doing something other then connect.  
                                                                      
*ONLY                                                                 
    There is only one object with this name and type in the solution. 
                                                                      
route code                                                            
    Specify the name of the route code where this solution resides.

pathExtensionLibraryCode.description:
Specify the path extension code of this solution. This code only needs to be specified if you are doing something other then connect.         
                                                                       
*ONLY                                                                  
    There is only one object with this name and type in the solution.  
                                                                       
path extension code                                                    
    Specify the path extension code where this solution resides.       

See the description of the path extension code for more information.

iFSObjectCode.description:
Specify the name of the object (e.g. file or directory) to be used.  The full name of the object is a concatenation of the value specified in the IDRC-parameter followed by the value in this (IFSOBJ) parameter.        
                                                                        
*OBJC                                                                   
    Use this value if you want to specify an object from the OS/400 library structure instead of the integrated file system.

iFSDirectoryCode.description: Specify the directory containing the object specified on the IFSOBJ-parameter. You cannot specify the directory QSYS.LIB or any directory below QSYS.LIB

longDescription.description: *SAME Use this value to indicate that long description does not change.

updateDb.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

updateBuffer.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

applicationCode.description: Specify the application code of the task to which the object must be connected.

fixNumber.description: Specify the task to which the object must be connected.

objectCode.description:
Specify the object which must be connected to the task.

 *IFSOBJ

     file system (IFS) instead of the normal OS/400 library structure.   
                                                                         
 character-value

memberCode.description:
When connecting a message or a source member the name of this detail must also be specified. The possible values are:                    

 *NONE                                                
     No detail is involved.                           
                                                      
 detail-code                                          
     Specify the name of the message or source member.

objectLibrary.description: Specify the library of the object.

environmentCode.description:
Specify the environment code of the object. This attribute is used to specify some special values for the solution.  The possible values are:       

*OBJD                                                                   
    The environment is retrieved from the object's object description. This value is not allowed if a new object is connected. A new object is an object which is not yet known to TD/OMS.             

*ANY                                                                    
    Use this special value to give the special status *ANY to the object. The *ANY status is a virtual environment which is equal to the actual environment of the object. The *ANY environment is used to allow a quick transport of objects to the development environment and is created because an object transfer cannot handle objects originating from different environments. 
   The only transfer possible from the *ANY environment is to the development environment. This enables a mass connection and transfer of related objects which are currently not in the same environment.

sourceProcessing.description:
Indicate if the source also has to be transferred through the maintenance cycle. The possible values are:           

*SAME                                                    
    The source processing does not change. If the object is connected to the fix the source processing will become *YES if the object has a related source (found or not found) and *NONE if the object does not have a source (like a data area). Future solution types may cause the source processing to depend on it. 

*YES                                                                    
    If the object is transferred through the maintenance cycle, so will the related source.                                                 

*NO
    The object is related to a source, but the source is not transferred through the maintenance cycle.                                      
                                                                        
*NONE                                                                   
    The object is not related to a source.

overrideCode.description:
If an object is transferred through the maintenance cycle, it is possible that it is overtaking a copy of itself which is connected to another fix. In this case the solutions merge into one but stay connected to two or more
different fixes. This is called solution merging.         
                                                          
When a merged solution is transferred all other fixes will follow. This is easy to understand if you see that it is actually the same object which is transferred. The possible values are:                                      

*SAME                                                    
    Indicates that the override code does not change. If an object is first connected to a fix the solution is not a merged object, not even when it is already connected to another fix. In this case an error is reported to the calling program stating that the object is already connected to another fix.          

*MERGED                                                
    If the object you are about to connect is already connected to another fix, this value will cause it to be connected as a merged object.         

*LEAD (DEPRECATED)                                                  
    This value is retained for backwards compatibility. Please see  *MERGED.                                                        
                                                                    
*FOLLOW (DEPRECATED)                                                
    This value is retained for backwards compatibility. Please see  *MERGED.

solutionType.description:
The solution type indicates what actions are planned on the connected object. The possible values are:         

*SAME                                                      
    Indicates that the solution type does not change. This value defaults to *CHANGE when an object is first connected connected to a fix.                          

*CHANGE                                                 
    Use this value to indicate an object on which maintenance is to be performed. The connected source is also transferred through the maintenance cycle and normal version numbering is executed on the object.   

*COMPILE                                                   
    Use this value to indicate an object on which no maintenance is to be performed. This solution type can be used when only a recompile of the object is required.                                              

*TERMINATE                                                
    Use this solution type to indicate an object which has reached the end of its life. If this solution is transferred through the maintenance cycle and it finds one or more copies of itself then these copies are deleted. The last step is the deletion of the object in the production environment.

statusField.description:
Specify the status assigned to the solution. The possible values are: 

*ACT                                                                     
    Connect this object as an active solution. The object can only be connected once as an active solution.                                
                                                                         
*LOCK                                                                    
    Connect this object to the fix and lock it in the process. This means that the same object can be connected to another fix.          
                                                                         
*CMP                                                                     
    The object can be completed when it is in the highest environment. You can use this status to build a solution history.

iFSObjectCode.description:
Specify the name of the object (e.g. file or directory) to be used.  The full name of the object is a concatenation of the value specified in the IDRC-parameter followed by the value in this (IFSOBJ) parameter.        
                                                                        
*OBJC                                                                   
    Use this value if you want to specify an object from the OS/400 library structure instead of the integrated file system.

iFSDirectoryCode.description: Specify the directory containing the object specified on the IFSOBJ-parameter. You cannot specify the directory QSYS.LIB or any directory below QSYS.LIB

updateDb.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

updateBuffer.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

include4GLGeneratedObjects.description: Utilize this value for connecting a 4GL object to a fix.

forceActiveSolution.description: Use this element to activate the object as a solution, ensuring exclusive connection by locking other solutions.

newObject.description: Specify the object's status as either known to TD/OMS or still under construction

suggestAlternativeObject.description: Specify whether you want the suggestions for a object in case of conflict

connectResponse.description: This is used to get the output for the action connect.

solutionAlternativeText.description: This field is designed to get the alternative text in case of conflict for a particular object.

sequenceNumber.description: To get the sequence about the conflict Number.

action.description: To get the conflict object conflict action.

txt.description: To get the object conflict text.

solutionConflict.description: To get the data about the object conflict.

value.messageText: Unauthorized or expired token. Please login again.

Application code XXXX does not exist. &N Cause . . . . . :   You have entered an application code which does not exist. &N Recovery  . . . :   Enter a valid application code and try your request again.

response200.summary: Response to a successful API call.
